definition: large-scale Chinese opera/Beijing opera/major dramatic production (movie, TV series etc)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The famous actor is now appearing in Hamlet at the Grand Theatre.
sentences.chinese: 这位名演员正在大戏院演出《哈姆雷特》。

sentences.english: This day, Fu-ho cinema was temporary off from our life.
sentences.chinese: 这天，福和大戏院他暂时从缺于我们的生活。

sentences.english: She plays at the National Theatre tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚她在国家大戏院演出。

sentences.english: I happened to pass by the Grand Theater and see the poster.
sentences.chinese: 我碰巧经过大戏院并看到海报。

sentences.english: Very difficult to imagine, plans these two major drama's direction is Lipi .
sentences.chinese: 很难想象，策划这两场大戏的导演均是里皮。

sentences.english: The latest revival toured theatres and received critical acclaim.
sentences.chinese: 最近的复演在各大戏院巡回演出，并获得一致好评。

definition: to screen (a movie)/to stage (a play)/a screening/a staging
(of a play, movie etc) to begin
each new high point replaced by another/(of a movie etc) one climax after another
(slang) (lit.) to tear cunt/(fig.) (of females) to have a catfight/to have a bitch fight
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
to make up and go on stage (idiom); to embark on a career (esp. in politics or crime)
to beat the gong to open a performance
The End (appearing at the end of a movie etc)
